about_the_game:
Get ready for the ultimate climbing & bouldering simulation game, with more than 250 routes across real-world European locations. Made by real climbers, New Heights allows you to experience some of the real challenges and feelings that come up when you're up there.

New Heights comes with workshop support for creating & sharing custom routes and fully custom locations.

Experience Climbing on a New Level

New Heights allows you to experience parts of the real climbing experience and technique. It features the most realistic physics-based climbing mechanics to date, taking grip, balance, body position and hold directions into account. Approach climbing and bouldering problems just like in real life. Feel the adrenaline rush as you make your way upwards, and the sense of accomplishment as you reach the top.

Explore Epic European Crags

Explore more than 25 of routes across Europe, from quick boulder sessions in Fontainbleau to 30 minute climbs at Freÿr, Belgium and old ruins of castles and chapels. Push the boundaries of what's possible in climbing and bouldering. Try out free solo climbing and bouldering from the safety of your computer and climb routes that are inaccessible in real life.

Create Custom Routes and Locations

Create locations with full creative freedom using our custom Unity-based workshop tool. Set your routes with pre-made holds, or import any 3D model to climb it in New Heights. Or design new pitches while climbing at existing crags. The workshop possibilities are vast!

Key Features

  • Realistic climbing gameplay: physics-based climbing mechanics that test your balance, body position and grip. Dyno's are also supported.
  • More than 250 real world routes: Real cliffs and structures made possible by photogrammetry and drones. New content is added regularly.
  • Climb the impossible: Climb in locations you might never visit, or where it's not allowed in real life. Try out free solo climbing from the safety of your computer.
  • Workshop support: Create and share your own routes in New Heights, and create fully custom locations with our Unity-based tool.
  • Leaderboards: (Optionally) compete with your friends and other players to get the fastest times on the leaderboards.
  • Climb when you can't: Experience that climbing feeling even if you're injured or otherwise unable to climb. Conquer fear of heights in a virtual setting, or climb your favourite route on a really rainy day.

New Heights is the ultimate climbing and bouldering game for anyone who wants to experience the thrill of climbing in the most authentic and immersive way possible. Get ready to reach new heights!

name: New Heights: Realistic Climbing and Bouldering

package_groups.name: default
package_groups.title: Buy New Heights: Realistic Climbing and Bouldering

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 or later
  • Processor: i3 or Ryzen 3
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GeForce GTX 950 or Radeon HD 7970
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 15 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 or later
  • Processor: i5 or Ryzen 5
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: GeForce GTX 1060 or Radeon RX 580
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 15 GB available space

reviews:
“New Heights is the first video game to capture the physics of rock climbing. Every climber should give it a try”
Climbing - Powered by Outside

“Rock Climbing Sim New Heights is a Leg-Twisty, Arm-Bendy Good Time”
Gamespew

“Unbelievable, a proper simulator and No Mistake. This is probably my favourite game of 2023”
Sim UK Reviews
short_description: The ultimate climbing and bouldering simulation game. Explore and climb 250 real world routes, create your own routes and compete against your friends from the safety of your computer.
supported_languages:
English*, Dutch, French, German, Spanish - Spain, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese - Brazil, Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese
*languages with full audio support
